title: Uber plans to sell around $10 billion worth of stock in IPO
text: Uber Technologies Inc has decided it will seek to sell around $10 billion worth of stock in its initial public offering, and will make public the registration of this offering

title: Investors may think the market is reaching a top, but I'm not buying it, Jim Cramer says
text: Jim Cramer breaks down 10 reasons that people forecast the market could soon reverse course.

title: Number of Deals a Barometer of M&A Market, Wolf Says
text: Apr.09 -- Daniel Wolf, mergers and acquisitions partner at Kirkland & Ellis LLP, discusses the m&a landscape with Bloomberg's Ed Hammond and Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: S&P 500, Nasdaq on pace for worst day since March 27
text: Ben Laidler, HSBC global equity strategist, and Jack Bouroudjian, UCX chief economist and co-founder, joins 'Closing Bell' for Closing Bell Exchange. The panel discusses the inversion of the yield curve, signs of a global slowdown and other factors weighing on the stock market.

title: Laurentian CEO Says Canadian Banks Are Strong, Resilient
text: Apr.09 -- Laurentian Bank of Canada Chief Executive Officer Francois Desjardins discusses the health of Canadian banks, stock shorting, and Canada's economy. He speaks with Bloomberg's Amanda Lang and Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: The US could be stuck in a 'Forever Trade War'
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman sits down with the "Power Lunch" team to discuss the IMF cutting their forecast on fears of a global slowdown and a potential, perpetual trade war with no end in sight.

title: Lawsuit alleges Uber didn't do enough to stop fake drivers in Los Angeles
text: Nine women are alleging in a new lawsuit against Uber that the company didn't do enough to respond to fake drivers sexually assualting women. CNBC's Deirdre Bosa reports.

title: We never had free trade, says former director of the NEC
text: Larry Lindsey, CEO and president of The Lindsey Group and former director of the National Economic Council, joins CNBC's "The Exchange" to talk about the possibility of a semi-permanent trade war and how the markets will react.

title: Zoom Video Sets Price Terms As IPO Market Activity Intensifies
text: The Zoom Video IPO comes as the market for public offerings accelerates, fueled by the Lyft IPO, to be followed by Jumia Technologies, PagerDuty and Tufin Software Technologies this week.

title: 'Retail is detail': Siam Piwat CEO reflects on her father's legacy | Managing Asia
text: Chadatip Chutrakul, CEO of Siam Piwat, shares how Iconsiam, the biggest mall in Thailand, was borne out of her father's vision to have a development by the Chao Phraya River that will bring "fame to the nation".

title: IAS CEO on the opportunity of new media platform ad measurement | Marketing Media Money
text: Lisa Utzschneider tells CNBC's James Wright what they're doing to help marketers measure marketing ROI with new media advertising opportunities, but why is it giving her a small headache?

title: Use money "parties" to take control of your finances
text:
Money coach, Ashley Feinstein Gerstley breaks down her four tools to take control of your finances as a couple. 

Invest in You: Ready.

title: Untuckit CEO on brand credibility and disrupting the retail shirt business
text: Chris Riccobono CEO of Untuckit discusses the success of his shirt business, branding and the company's plan for expansion.

title: Workers worry about robots stealing jobs, just not their jobs. They may be overconfident
text: A majority of workers across the US say they do not feel their job security is threatened by technology, according to a new CNBC/SurveyMonkey workplace analysis.

title: Likelihood markets go higher on US-China trade deal is modest: OppenheimerFunds CIO
text: Shawn Matthews, former Cantor Fitzgerald CEO, and Krishna Memani, Oppenheimer Funds CIO, join 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss the concerns weighing on the markets and where they see it headed.

title: Markets open lower amid trade and tariff fears
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: On Edge: Awaiting Key Developments, Market Appears Pensive Ahead Of News
text: The market looks like itâ€™s on the cusp of a lot of big news, including Brexit, earnings and Fed minutes. But the China tariff situation is still number one on the list of important things to consider watching.

title: Here's how Jim Cramer thinks central banks might react to the IMF growth outlook cut
text: The IMF expects the world economy to grow by 3.3% in 2019, down from 3.5%. CNBC's Jim Cramer discusses how central banks around the world might react to the forecast.

title: 3 Things to Know About Zoom Before Its IPO
text: The second thing might surprise you for such a young company

title: Here's what to expect from earnings season
text: Charles Campbell, trading desk specialist at MKM Partners, and Chris Retzler, portfolio manager at Needham Growth Fund, join "Squawk Box" ahead of the Fed's minutes and the onset of earnings week.

title: 75,000 more stores need to close across the US, UBS estimates, as online sales and Amazon grow
text: Clothing retailers, consumer electronics companies and home furnishing businesses will need to close more stores across the U.S., as e-commerce sales continue to account for a larger portion of total retail sales, UBS writes in a note to clients.

title: Robotic heads powered by A.I. to help passengers at a major German airport
text: The trial will last for six weeks at Frankfurt Airport in Germany.

title: Saudi Aramco's first-ever international bond sale reportedly tops $85 billion
text: CNBC's "Street Signs Europe" anchors Joumanna Bercetche and Julianna Tatelbaum discuss Saudi Aramco's debut bond offering.

title: Bapis: Q1 earnings will be a real gut-check for companies
text: Michael Bapis of Vios Advisors at Rockefeller Capital Management says companies will have to outperform with their Q1 results, as investors are skeptical about the market's rise so far this year.

title: The Security Premium Will Keep Oil Prices High
text: Political conflict, unrest and violence should keep oil prices elevated for the near future.

title: Financial Stability Board Calls For Vigilance Of Global Financial System Vulnerabilities
text: While many banks are in better shape than they were in 2008, a number of vulnerabilities exist in the financial system.

title: China Aircraft Leasing says has not put Boeing 737 Max order on hold
text: China Aircraft Leasing Group says it has not put its order for 100 Boeing 737 Max jets on hold nor had it suspended payment, rebutting an earlier report by the South China Morning Post newspaper.

title: The world's worst-performing currency could slip into 'crisis' mode later this year
text: Market volatility in Argentina could spark another currency crisis, analysts have told CNBC, as the country prepares for presidential elections later this year.

title: HSBC predicts China's 2019 GDP will soar past others' estimates
text: China's stimulus-boosted private sector is on track to lead the economy to a "self-sustained recovery" that could see growth hit 6.6 percent this year, according to HSBC.
